name: Pickled Eggs II
author: Rayna Jordan
summary: I made these when I had my bar, and they were always a big hit. I made them in large batches because of the standing time, but have scaled the recipe for home use. Extra large eggs are boiled, then pickled in a simple brine solution. For a variation, add dry minced onion flakes, crushed red pepper or hot sauce to the brine.
directions: Place eggs in a medium saucepan and cover with cold water
Bring water to a boil and immediately remove from heat
Cover and let eggs stand in hot water for 10 to 12 minutes
Remove from hot water, cool and peel
In a medium saucepan over medium heat, mix together the vinegar, water and pickling spice
Bring to a boil and mix in the garlic and bay leaf
Transfer the eggs to sterile containers
Fill the containers with the hot vinegar mixture, seal and refrigerate 8 to 10 days before serving
